item.title: Blackstone 在对 Hipgnosis 的 16 亿美元收购战中击败 Concord
item.description: Blackstone 已同意以约 15.7 亿美元的价格收购 Hipgnosis Songs Fund，此前这家私募股权投资巨头在夏奇拉和红辣椒等歌手的音乐所有者的收购战中击败了竞争对手 Concord。【原文：Blackstone has agreed to acquire Hipgnosis Songs Fund for about $1.57 billion, after the private equity giant outbid rival suitor Concord in the takeover battle for the music owner of artists such as Shakira and Red Hot Chili Peppers.】

item.title: 邮政银行发布公告后，德意志银行盘前交易下跌 4.9
item.description: 德意志银行股价在周一盘前交易中下跌 4.9%，此前有消息称，这家德国最大的贷款机构可能要在一场长达数年的诉讼中承担高达 13 亿欧元（约合 13.9 亿美元）的赔偿责任，该诉讼声称德意志银行在收购邮政银行时支付的费用过低。【原文：Deutsche Bank shares were 4.9% lower in premarket trade on Monday after news that Germany's largest lender could be on the hook for up to 1.3 billion euros ($1.39 billion) in a yearslong lawsuit claiming it underpaid in its purchase of Postbank.】

item.title: 农用化学品公司先正达第一季度销售和盈利大幅下降
item.description: 种子和农药生产商先正达公司周一表示，该公司第一季度的销售额和利润大幅下降，而就在几周前，这家瑞士公司刚刚搁置了 100 亿美元的上市计划。【原文：Seeds and pesticides maker Syngenta suffered big drops in first quarter sales and profit, the company said on Monday, just a few weeks after the Swiss company shelved its plans for a $10 billion flotation.】

item.title: 维旺迪称正在对计划中的分拆进行可行性研究
item.description: 法国媒体集团维旺迪（Vivendi）周一表示，将其业务拆分为四家独立公司的可行性研究正在取得进展。【原文：French media conglomerate Vivendi said on Monday that a feasibility study for the plan to split its business into four separate companies was progressing.】

item.title: 中国 4 月份工厂活动扩张速度可能放缓
item.description: 路透社周一的一项民意调查显示，中国 4 月份制造业活动的扩张速度可能有所放缓，这表明中国庞大的工厂部门可能在第二季度初失去了一些动力。【原文：China's manufacturing activity in April likely expanded at a slower pace, a Reuters poll showed on Monday, indicating the country's sprawling factory sector may have lost some momentum at the start of the second quarter.】

item.title: 中国房地产股因刺激政策希望而反弹
item.description: 中国房地产开发商的股票周一上涨，原因是市场猜测本周可能会出台更多刺激措施，以清理库存、促进销售和取消购房限制。【原文：Shares of Chinese property developers rallied on Monday on speculation more stimulus measures are likely to be unveiled this week aimed at clearing inventory, boosting sales and lifting home purchase restrictions.】

item.title: Blackstone 旗下的皇冠度假村将裁员多达 1,000 人，挑战日益严峻
item.description: Blackstone 旗下的皇冠度假村（Crown Resorts）周一表示，由于疲软的经济形势继续影响其业务，且该公司正努力履行监管义务，因此将在墨尔本、珀斯和悉尼削减多达 1,000 个职位。【原文：Blackstone-owned Crown Resorts will cut up to 1,000 roles in Melbourne, Perth and Sydney, it said on Monday, as weak economic conditions continue to impact its business and as it struggles to keep up with regulatory obligations.】

item.title: 飞利浦就呼吸机召回事件在美国支付 11 亿美元和解费
item.description: 荷兰医疗设备制造商飞利浦公司周一表示，已同意支付 11 亿美元，以解决美国与全球召回用于治疗睡眠呼吸暂停症的呼吸机有关的人身伤害案件。【原文：Dutch medical devices maker Philips said on Monday it had agreed to pay $1.1 billion in a settlement of personal injury cases in the United States related to the global recall of ventilators used to treat sleep apnea.】

item.title: 4 月份韩国芯片主导的出口增长将加快
item.description: 路透社周一的一项民意调查显示，由于芯片销售强劲，韩国 4 月份的出口预计将以更快的速度增长，连续第七个月扩大涨幅。【原文：South Korea's exports are expected to have risen at a faster pace in April, extending gains for a seventh straight month on strong chip sales, a Reuters poll showed on Monday.】

item.title: OpenAI 的 ChatGPT 成为奥地利隐私投诉的目标
item.description: 微软支持的初创公司OpenAI周一发现自己成了倡导组织NOYB的隐私投诉目标，原因是OpenAI的生成式人工智能聊天机器人ChatGPT提供的错误信息可能违反了欧盟的隐私规则，而OpenAI却没有对这些信息进行修复。【原文：Microsoft-backed startup OpenAI on Monday found itself the target of a privacy complaint by advocacy group NOYB for allegedly not fixing incorrect information provided by its generative AI chatbot ChatGPT that may breach EU privacy rules.】

item.title: 市场：经济意外扰乱了市场最喜爱的衰退预测指标
item.description: 过去曾可靠预测美国经济衰退的一种债券市场异常现象，今年可能会以一种极不寻常的方式正常化。这令市场担忧。【原文：A bond market anomaly that has reliably predicted a U.S. recession in the past may normalize this year in a highly unusual manner. It's a worry for markets.】

item.title: 菲利浦-莫里斯公司在美国推动加热烟草面临关键考验
item.description: 分析师和投资者表示，菲利普-莫里斯国际公司在美国的加热烟草目标是可以实现的，尽管竞争对手认为在一个电子烟占主导地位的市场中，加热烟草的潜力有限。【原文：Philip Morris International's goals for heated tobacco in the United States are reachable, analysts and investors say, even though rivals see limited potential in a market where vaping dominates.】

item.title: 法庭文件显示，壳牌每年从美国原油交易中获利 10 亿美元
item.description: 壳牌庞大的石油和天然气贸易业务的财务细节是该公司最不为人知的秘密。不过，一名前雇员提起的诉讼中的文件显示，壳牌在美国的原油交易每年定期赚取约 10 亿美元。【原文：Financial details of Shell's vast oil and gas trading business are some of the company's closest-held secrets. Documents in a lawsuit filed by a former employee, however, revealed its U.S. crude trading regularly earns around $1 billion every year.】

item.title: 出口强劲，台湾第一季度经济增长 5.6%：路透社民调
item.description: 路透社周一的一项民意调查显示，台湾依赖贸易的经济在第一季度可能会加速增长，原因是对人工智能（AI）应用技术的需求向好，从而支撑了出口反弹。【原文：Taiwan's trade-dependent economy likely grew faster in the first quarter, supported by a rebound in exports amid upbeat demand for the technology that powers artificial intelligence (AI) applications, a Reuters poll showed on Monday.】

item.title: 第二届全球人工智能安全峰会面临棘手问题，参与人数减少
item.description: 去年，世界各国领导人、企业高管和学术专家齐聚英国布莱切利公园，参加世界上首次全球人工智能安全峰会，希望就如何监管这项有人警告会对人类构成威胁的技术达成共识。【原文：Last year, a who’s who of world leaders, corporate executives and academic experts gathered at Britain’s Bletchley Park for the world’s first global AI Safety Summit, hoping to reach consensus on the regulation of a technology some warned posed a threat to humanity.】

item.title: 早间竞价日元的神秘走势
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 消息人士称，百度与特斯拉就 FSD 在中国的地图交易达成一致
item.description: 两位熟悉此事的人士称，中国主要互联网搜索公司百度与特斯拉达成协议，允许这家汽车公司使用百度的地图许可证，在中国的公共道路上收集数据。【原文：Baidu, China's major internet search company, reached an agreement with Tesla to grant the car company access to its mapping license for data collection on China's public roads, two people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社：特斯拉与百度的交易扫清了中国辅助驾驶的关键障碍
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一报道，特斯拉将通过与百度在地图和导航功能方面的合作，为在中国推出其先进的辅助驾驶功能扫清一个关键障碍。【原文：Tesla is set to clear a key hurdle to introduce its advanced assisted driving features in China by partnering with Baidu for mapping and navigation functions, Bloomberg News reported on Monday.】

item.title: 中国房地产开发商凯撒清算听证会延期至 5 月 27 日举行
item.description: 香港一家法院将凯撒集团的清算听证会延期至 5 月 27 日，这家陷入困境的中国房地产开发商表示，其目标是在未来四周内确定重组条款。【原文：A Hong Kong court adjourned a hearing to liquidate Kaisa Group to May 27, as the embattled Chinese property developer said it aims to iron out restructuring terms in the coming four weeks.】

item.title: 电池巨头 CATL 老板造访埃隆-马斯克在北京的酒店 - 路透社见证
item.description: 中国电池巨头 CATL 董事长周一访问了埃隆-马斯克下榻的北京一家酒店，特斯拉首席执行官一天前抵达中国首都进行了一次不事先通知的访问。【原文：The chairman of Chinese battery giant CATL visited a hotel in Beijing on Monday where Elon Musk is staying, after the Tesla CEO arrived in the Chinese capital a day ago on an unannounced visit.】

item.title: 美联储阴影笼罩，亚洲股市上涨；日元跌破关键水平
item.description: 在美联储本周晚些时候召开政策会议之前，亚洲股市周一开局良好，而美元几十年来首次突破了 160 日元的心理关键水平。【原文：Asian stocks got off to a positive start on Monday ahead of the Federal Reserve's policy meeting later in the week, while the dollar broke past the psychologically key level of 160 yen for the first time in decades.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，雷德斯通、埃里森向派拉蒙投资者提出让步
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周日报道，雷德斯通（Redstone）家族和 Skydance Media 首席执行官大卫-埃里森（David Ellison）都做出了让步，以使派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）潜在的控制权变更对该公司的其他投资者更具吸引力。【原文：The Redstone family and Skydance Media CEO David Ellison have both made concessions to make a potential change in control at Paramount Global more appealing the company's other investors, Bloomberg News reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 市场静待美联储，美元小幅走软
item.description: 受日本假期影响，美元在周一早盘交易中略微走软，不过日元、欧元和英镑仍维持在上周五震荡时段触及的区间底部附近。【原文：The U.S. dollar was a shade softer in early deals on Monday, thinned by a holiday in Japan, though the yen, euro and sterling stayed near the bottom of the ranges hit during Friday's volatile session.】

item.title: 油价因美国通胀担忧而收窄涨幅
item.description: 周一亚市早盘，油价下跌，扭转了上周五的涨势，原因是美国通胀数据进一步暗淡了很快降息的前景，并提振了美元，损害了石油需求。【原文：Oil prices fell in early Asian trading on Monday, reversing gains from Friday as U.S. inflation data further dimmed the prospects of interest rate cuts anytime soon and boosted the dollar, which hurts oil demand.】

item.title: SK Innovation 预计第二季度炼油利润稳健，电池部门亏损扩大
item.description: 韩国最大炼油企业 SK Energy 的所有者 SK Innovation Co Ltd 周一表示，由于需求坚挺，预计第二季度炼油利润率将继续保持稳健。【原文：SK Innovation Co Ltd , owner of South Korea's top refiner SK Energy, said on Monday it expects solid refining margins to continue in the second quarter backed by firm demand.】

item.title: 星空娱乐执行主席福斯特卸任，管理层出走潮再添新丁
item.description: 星际娱乐公司（Star Entertainment）周一表示，其执行主席大卫-福斯特（David Foster）在上任仅几周后就将离职，这使这家陷入困境的澳大利亚赌场运营商的高级管理层又出现了一次大换血。【原文：Star Entertainment said on Monday its Executive Chairman David Foster will leave step down just weeks after being appointed to the role, adding to an exodus of senior management at the beleaguered Australian casino operator.】

item.title: 独家报道中国企业 "转入地下 "支付俄罗斯款项，银行纷纷退缩
item.description: 中国南方的一家电器制造商发现很难将产品运往俄罗斯，这并不是因为这些小工具有什么问题，而是因为中国的大银行出于对美国制裁的担忧，正在限制此类交易的支付。【原文：An appliance maker in southern China is finding it hard to ship its products to Russia, not because of any problems with the gadgets but because China's big banks are throttling payments for such transactions out of concern over U.S. sanctions.】

item.title: 2024 年第一季度英国汽车保费小幅上涨
item.description: 周一的一项调查显示，英国第一季度的汽车保险费用上涨了 1%，表明去年保费上涨的势头有所缓解。【原文：The cost of car insurance in the UK rose 1% in the first quarter, a survey showed on Monday, indicating an easing in the rise of premium seen last year.】

item.title: 新加坡电信（Singtel）预计 2024 年下半年将出现亏损；标志性减值 23 亿美元
item.description: 新加坡电信公司（Singapore Telecommunications）周一表示，预计 2024 财年下半年将出现净亏损，因为该公司在此期间计提了 31 亿新元（22.8 亿美元）的非现金减值准备。【原文：Singapore Telecommunications said on Monday it expects to report a net loss for second-half of fiscal year 2024, as it flagged exceptional non-cash impairment provisions of S$3.1 billion ($2.28 billion) for the period.】

item.title: 友邦保险第一季度新业务价值增长 31%，宣布回购 20 亿美元
item.description: 总部位于香港的友邦保险集团周一公布，受惠于各业务部门的强劲表现，按固定汇率计算的第一季度新业务价值（VONB）上升 31%，并宣布额外回购 20 亿美元股票。【原文：Hong Kong-based insurer AIA Group on Monday posted a 31% rise in its first-quarter value of new business (VONB) on a constant exchange currency basis helped by strong performance across segments, and announced an additional $2 billion share buyback.】
